channel.title: [Request] Auto Right Clicker
channel.description:
Sorry. I dont know if ypou can request here or not... but I need a Auto Right Clicker... like, not Click Click Click
I need it doesnt let go. So:
Click ... ... *still holding*
Have certain Buttons to start and stop it?
Im not sure if thats possible in Java, im just curious. For any of you wondering what Im using it for: PremiumMu, I need to train. ;)
Thanks

item.title: [Request] Auto Right Clicker
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

This should work:

[code]import java.awt.AWTException;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Robot;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.InputEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;

import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JTextField;

public class RightClicker implements ActionListener, Runnable
{
private JFrame jFramage;
private JPanel jPanelage;

private JButton starterer;
private JButton selectCoords;

private JLabel clickCoords;

private JTextField waiting;

private int x = 0;
private int y = 0;
private int wait = 100;

private Robot bot;
private boolean running = false;

public RightClicker()
{
	jFramage = new JFrame("Right Clicker by Imafatmess");
	jPanelage = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());

	java.awt.event.KeyAdapter adapter = new java.awt.event.KeyAdapter()
	{
		public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
		{
			int id = e.getKeyCode();
			if (id == e.VK_R)
				running = true;
			else if (id == e.VK_S)
				running = false;
		}
	};

	java.awt.event.MouseMotionAdapter adapter2 = new java.awt.event.MouseMotionAdapter()
	{
		public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
		{
			System.out.println("Mouse moved to " + e.getX() + ", " + e.getY());
		}
	};

	starterer = new JButton("START!");
	starterer.addActionListener(this);
	starterer.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
	starterer.setToolTipText("Start/Stop the right clicking!");
	jPanelage.add(starterer, BorderLayout.EAST);

	selectCoords = new JButton("Select Coords");
	selectCoords.addActionListener(this);
	selectCoords.setToolTipText("Allows you to select the coords to click");
	jPanelage.add(selectCoords, BorderLayout.WEST);
	selectCoords.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
	selectCoords.setEnabled(false);

	clickCoords = new JLabel("0, 0");
	jPanelage.add(clickCoords, BorderLayout.SOUTH);

	waiting = new JTextField(new Integer(wait).toString(), 5);
	waiting.addKeyListener(adapter);
	waiting.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
	jPanelage.add(waiting, BorderLayout.NORTH);

	jFramage.setResizable(false);
	jFramage.add(jPanelage);
	jFramage.pack();
	jFramage.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
	jFramage.setVisible(true);
	jFramage.addKeyListener(adapter);
	jFramage.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
	new Thread(this).start();
}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
	new RightClicker();
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt)
{
	Object o = evt.getSource();
	if (o.equals(selectCoords))
	{
		x = Integer.parseInt(javax.swing.JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "What will be the new X coord?"));
		y = Integer.parseInt(javax.swing.JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "What will be the new Y coord?"));
	}
	if (o.equals(starterer))
	{
		running = true;
		starterer.setText("Stop");
		starterer.setActionCommand("Stop");
	}
	if (evt.getActionCommand().equals("Stop"))
	{
		running = false;
		starterer.setText("Start");
		starterer.setActionCommand("");
	}
}

public void run()
{
	try { bot = new Robot(); }
	catch (AWTException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }

	while (running)
	{
		System.out.println("loop");
		bot.setAutoDelay(wait / 2);
	//	bot.mouseMove(x, y);
		bot.setAutoDelay(wait / 2);
		bot.mousePress(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK);
		bot.mouseRelease(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK);
	}
	while (!running) ;
	run();
}

}[/code]

If you deem it necessary to select the coordinates for whatever reason, comment out the line:

selectCoords.setEnabled(false);

and uncomment the line:

// bot.mouseMove(x, y);

Read full topic

item.title: [Request] Auto Right Clicker
item.dc:creator: @Carazon Carazon ™
item.description:
@Carazon wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:6, topic:134971”][code]
import java.awt.AWTException;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Robot;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.InputEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener;

import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JTextField;

public class RightClicker implements ActionListener, Runnable
{
private JFrame jFramage;
private JPanel jPanelage;

private JButton starterer;
private JButton selectCoords;

private JLabel clickCoords;

private JTextField waiting;

private int x = 0;
private int y = 0;
private int wait = 100;

private Robot bot;
private boolean running = false;

public RightClicker()
{
	jFramage = new JFrame("Right Clicker by Imafatmess");
	jPanelage = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());

	java.awt.event.KeyAdapter adapter = new java.awt.event.KeyAdapter()
	{
		public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
		{
			int id = e.getKeyCode();
			if (id == e.VK_R)
				running = true;
			else if (id == e.VK_S)
				running = false;
		}
	};

	java.awt.event.MouseMotionAdapter adapter2 = new java.awt.event.MouseMotionAdapter()
	{
		public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
		{
			System.out.println("Mouse moved to " + e.getX() + ", " + e.getY());
		}
	};

	starterer = new JButton("START!");
	starterer.addActionListener(this);
	starterer.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
	starterer.setToolTipText("Start/Stop the right clicking!");
	jPanelage.add(starterer, BorderLayout.EAST);

	selectCoords = new JButton("Select Coords");
	selectCoords.addActionListener(this);
	selectCoords.setToolTipText("Allows you to select the coords to click");
	jPanelage.add(selectCoords, BorderLayout.WEST);
	selectCoords.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);

	clickCoords = new JLabel("0, 0");
	jPanelage.add(clickCoords, BorderLayout.SOUTH);

	waiting = new JTextField(new Integer(wait).toString(), 5);
	waiting.addKeyListener(adapter);
	waiting.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
	jPanelage.add(waiting, BorderLayout.NORTH);

	jFramage.setResizable(false);
	jFramage.add(jPanelage);
	jFramage.pack();
	jFramage.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
	jFramage.setVisible(true);
	jFramage.addKeyListener(adapter);
	jFramage.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
	new Thread(this).start();
}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
	new RightClicker();
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt)
{
	Object o = evt.getSource();
	if (o.equals(selectCoords))
	{
		x = Integer.parseInt(javax.swing.JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "What will be the new X coord?"));
		y = Integer.parseInt(javax.swing.JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "What will be the new Y coord?"));
	}
	if (o.equals(starterer))
	{
		running = true;
		starterer.setText("Stop");
		starterer.setActionCommand("Stop");
	}
	if (evt.getActionCommand().equals("Stop"))
	{
		running = false;
		starterer.setText("Start");
		starterer.setActionCommand("");
	}
}

public void run()
{
	try { bot = new Robot(); }
	catch (AWTException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }

	while (running)
	{
		System.out.println("loop");
		bot.setAutoDelay(wait / 2);
		bot.mouseMove(x, y);
		bot.setAutoDelay(wait / 2);
		bot.mousePress(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK);
		bot.mouseRelease(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK);
	}
	while (!running) ;
	run();
}

}
[/code]

imafatmess left out some things.[/quote]
Great it worked! But… I cant move my mouse… it will always jump back to the Coords, can you remove the Coords thing? Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: [Request] Auto Right Clicker
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

import java.awt.AWTException;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Robot;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.InputEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener;

import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JTextField;


public class RightClicker implements ActionListener, Runnable
{
	private JFrame jFramage;
	private JPanel jPanelage;

	private JButton starterer;
	private JButton selectCoords;

	private JLabel clickCoords;

	private JTextField waiting;

	private int x = 0;
	private int y = 0;
	private int wait = 100;

	private Robot bot;
	private boolean running = false;

	public RightClicker()
	{
		jFramage = new JFrame("Right Clicker by Imafatmess");
		jPanelage = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());

		java.awt.event.KeyAdapter adapter = new java.awt.event.KeyAdapter()
		{
			public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
			{
				int id = e.getKeyCode();
				if (id == e.VK_R)
					running = true;
				else if (id == e.VK_S)
					running = false;
			}
		};

		java.awt.event.MouseMotionAdapter adapter2 = new java.awt.event.MouseMotionAdapter()
		{
			public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
			{
				System.out.println("Mouse moved to " + e.getX() + ", " + e.getY());
			}
		};

		starterer = new JButton("START!");
		starterer.addActionListener(this);
		starterer.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
		starterer.setToolTipText("Start/Stop the right clicking!");
		jPanelage.add(starterer, BorderLayout.EAST);

		selectCoords = new JButton("Select Coords");
		selectCoords.addActionListener(this);
		selectCoords.setToolTipText("Allows you to select the coords to click");
		jPanelage.add(selectCoords, BorderLayout.WEST);
		selectCoords.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);

		clickCoords = new JLabel("0, 0");
		jPanelage.add(clickCoords, BorderLayout.SOUTH);

		waiting = new JTextField(new Integer(wait).toString(), 5);
		waiting.addKeyListener(adapter);
		waiting.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
		jPanelage.add(waiting, BorderLayout.NORTH);

		jFramage.setResizable(false);
		jFramage.add(jPanelage);
		jFramage.pack();
		jFramage.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
		jFramage.setVisible(true);
		jFramage.addKeyListener(adapter);
		jFramage.addMouseMotionListener(adapter2);
		new Thread(this).start();
	}

	public static void main(String[] args)
	{
		new RightClicker();
	}

	public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt)
	{
		Object o = evt.getSource();
		if (o.equals(selectCoords))
		{
			x = Integer.parseInt(javax.swing.JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "What will be the new X coord?"));
			y = Integer.parseInt(javax.swing.JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "What will be the new Y coord?"));
		}
		if (o.equals(starterer))
		{
			running = true;
			starterer.setText("Stop");
			starterer.setActionCommand("Stop");
		}
		if (evt.getActionCommand().equals("Stop"))
		{
			running = false;
			starterer.setText("Start");
			starterer.setActionCommand("");
		}
	}

	public void run()
	{
		try { bot = new Robot(); }
		catch (AWTException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }

		while (running)
		{
			System.out.println("loop");
			bot.setAutoDelay(wait / 2);
			bot.mouseMove(x, y);
			bot.setAutoDelay(wait / 2);
			bot.mousePress(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK);
			bot.mouseRelease(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK);
		}
		while (!running) ;
		run();
	}
}

imafatmess left out some things.

item.title: [Request] Auto Right Clicker
item.dc:creator: @Carazon Carazon ™
item.description:
@Carazon wrote:

[quote=“imafatmess, post:2, topic:134971”]I don’t know why you don’t just do this in scar but I’ll write one for you (it’ll take about 10 mins probably)

This is kinda near finished, but isn’t exactly great. The select coords button isnt working yet (will do that in a bit). Also, the pressing a key on the keyboard to start and stop is also not working (can’t seem to get that to work) but other than that it’s ok I spose…

[code]import java.awt.AWTException;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Robot;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.InputEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener;

import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JTextField;

public class RightClicker implements ActionListener, KeyListener, Runnable
{
private JFrame jFramage;
private JPanel jPanelage;

private JButton starterer;
private JButton selectCoords;

private JLabel clickCoords;

private JTextField waiting;

private int x = 0;
private int y = 0;
private int wait = 100;

private Robot bot;
private boolean running;

public RightClicker()
{
	jFramage = new JFrame("Right Clicker by Imafatmess");
	jPanelage = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
	
	starterer = new JButton("START!");
	starterer.setActionCommand("Start");
	starterer.addActionListener(this);
	starterer.setToolTipText("Start/Stop the right clicking!");
	jPanelage.add(starterer, BorderLayout.EAST);
	
	selectCoords = new JButton("Select Coords");
	selectCoords.setActionCommand("Select Coords");
	selectCoords.addActionListener(this);
	selectCoords.setToolTipText("Allows you to select the coords to click");
	jPanelage.add(selectCoords, BorderLayout.WEST);
	
	clickCoords = new JLabel("0, 0");
	jPanelage.add(clickCoords, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
	
	waiting = new JTextField(new Integer(wait).toString(), 5);
	jPanelage.add(waiting, BorderLayout.NORTH);
	
	jFramage.setResizable(false);
	jFramage.add(jPanelage);
	jFramage.pack();
	jFramage.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
	jFramage.setVisible(true);		
	jFramage.addKeyListener(this);
}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
	new RightClicker();
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) 
{
	String c = evt.getActionCommand();
	if(c.equals("Select Coords"))
	{
		
	}
	if(c.equals("Start"))
	{
		this.run();
		starterer.setText("Stop");
		starterer.setActionCommand("Stop");
	}
	if(c.equals("Stop"))
	{
		running = false;
	}
}

public void keyPressed(KeyEvent kp) 
{
	int id = kp.getKeyCode();
	if (id == KeyEvent.VK_R)
 	{
		running = true;
 	}
	if (id == KeyEvent.VK_S)
 	{
		running = false;
 	}
}

public void keyReleased(KeyEvent arg0) {
}

public void keyTyped(KeyEvent arg0) {
}

public void run() 
{
	while(running)
	{
		try 
		{
			bot = new Robot();
		} 
		catch (AWTException e) 
		{
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
		bot.setAutoDelay(wait);
		bot.mouseMove(x, y);
		bot.mousePress(InputEvent.BUTTON2_MASK);
		bot.mouseRelease(InputEvent.BUTTON2_MASK);
	}
}

}[/code][/quote]
THANKS! The mouse coords doesnt matter in this game. You can right click anywere and it will do it automaticly… the Start / Stop isnt too bad. But would be better, anyways, THANKS!

Read full topic

item.title: [Request] Auto Right Clicker
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

I don’t know why you don’t just do this in scar but I’ll write one for you (it’ll take about 10 mins probably)

This is just about finished although the keylistener and mouselistener aren’t working properly (so coordinate selecting and starting and stopping with the keyboards do not work). This is because I don’t know how to add it for the whole desktop, rather than just the JFrame. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Anyway, the box at the top is for how long to wait between clicks…

[code=java]import java.awt.AWTException;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Robot;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.InputEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener;
import java.awt.event.MouseEvent;
import java.awt.event.MouseListener;

import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JTextField;

public class RightClicker implements ActionListener, KeyListener, MouseListener, Runnable
{
private JFrame jFramage;
private JPanel jPanelage;

private JButton starterer;
private JButton selectCoords;

private JLabel clickCoords;

private JTextField waiting;

private int x = 0;
private int y = 0;
private int wait = 100;

private Robot bot;

private boolean running = true;
private boolean clicking = false;
private boolean chooseCoords = false;

private Thread robotThread;

public RightClicker()
{
	jFramage = new JFrame("Right Clicker by Imafatmess");
	jPanelage = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
	
	starterer = new JButton("START!");
	starterer.setActionCommand("Start");
	starterer.addActionListener(this);
	starterer.setToolTipText("Start/Stop the right clicking!");
	jPanelage.add(starterer, BorderLayout.EAST);
	
	selectCoords = new JButton("Select Coords");
	selectCoords.setActionCommand("Select Coords");
	selectCoords.addActionListener(this);
	selectCoords.setToolTipText("Allows you to select the coords to click");
	jPanelage.add(selectCoords, BorderLayout.WEST);
	
	clickCoords = new JLabel(x + ", " + y);
	jPanelage.add(clickCoords, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
	
	waiting = new JTextField(new Integer(wait).toString(), 5);
	jPanelage.add(waiting, BorderLayout.NORTH);
	
	jFramage.setResizable(false);
	jFramage.add(jPanelage);
	jFramage.pack();
	jFramage.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
	jFramage.setVisible(true);		
	jFramage.addKeyListener(this);
	jFramage.addMouseListener(this);
	
	robotThread = new Thread(this, "RoboT");
	robotThread.start();
}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
	new RightClicker();
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) 
{
	String c = evt.getActionCommand();
	if(c.equals("Select Coords"))
	{
		chooseCoords = true;
		selectCoords.setEnabled(false);
	}
	if(c.equals("Start"))
	{
		clicking = false;
		starterer.setText("Stop");
		starterer.setActionCommand("Stop");
	}
	if(c.equals("Stop"))
	{
		clicking = false;
		starterer.setText("Start");
		starterer.setActionCommand("Start");
	}
}

public void keyPressed(KeyEvent kp) 
{
	int id = kp.getKeyCode();
	if (id == KeyEvent.VK_R)
 	{
		clicking = true;
		starterer.setText("Stop");
		starterer.setActionCommand("Stop");
 	}
	if (id == KeyEvent.VK_S)
 	{
		clicking = false;
		starterer.setText("Start");
		starterer.setActionCommand("Start");
 	}
}

public void keyReleased(KeyEvent arg0) {
}

public void keyTyped(KeyEvent arg0) {
}

public void run() 
{
	while(running)
	{
		while(clicking)
		{
			try 
			{
				bot = new Robot();
			} 
			catch (AWTException e) 
			{
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
			bot.setAutoDelay(wait);
			bot.mouseMove(x, y);
			bot.mousePress(InputEvent.BUTTON2_MASK);
			bot.mouseRelease(InputEvent.BUTTON2_MASK);
		}
	}
}

public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent me) 
{
	if(chooseCoords)
	{
		x = me.getX();
		y = me.getY();
		clickCoords.setText(x + ", " + y);
		chooseCoords = false;
		selectCoords.setEnabled(true);
	}
}

public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent arg0) {
}
